message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LO, cs.PL, cs.SE, cs.DB. 

The paper discusses a version of ASP with consistency restoring rules, which is a topic related to knowledge representation and reasoning. Therefore, cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the implementation and optimization of the system, which falls under the category of programming languages and compilers, making cs.PL (Programming Languages) another likely sub-category. The paper also mentions the use of SPARC for teaching and large applications, which suggests that it may be relevant to software engineering (cs.SE) and databases (cs.DB). Finally, the paper discusses the relationship between consistency restoring rules and weak constraints of DLV, which is a topic related to logic and computation, making cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science) a possible sub-category as well.
